roleset.name: fly through the air, travel via air, fly in a flock.,

alias.framenet: Self_motion Motion Bringing Ride_vehicle Operate_vehicle Escaping
Self_motion Motion Bringing Ride_vehicle Operate_vehicle Escaping

roleset.note: FLY-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls spatial_configuration-47.6, run-51.3.2, drive-11.5-1, nonvehicle-51.4.2. (from fly.01-v)
FLIGHT-V NOTES: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. No appropriate VerbNet entry found. Framed by Claire. (from flight.01-v)

FLIGHT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry fly.01, corresponds to VNcls spatial_configuration-47.6, run-51.3.2, drive-11.5-1, nonvehicle-51.4.2. Differs from verb roleset in that source and destination arguments seemed more important than benefactive, so these have been added and benefactive omitted (use argm-gol for benefactive) (from flight.01-n)
FLYING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT (from flying.01-n)

roles.note: It can be very difficult to determine if a subject is a pilot or a traveller. When in doubt, go with traveller. (from fly.01-v)

example.name: unaccusative, traveller as subject
example.text: And some investors fault Mr. Spiegel's life style; he earns millions of dollars a year and flies around in Columbia's jet planes.

example.name: transitive, pilot as subject
example.text: As a ``good-will measure,'' [the pilots]-1 had been working four extra hours a month and had agreed *trace*-1 to fly UAL's two new Boeing 747-400 aircraft.

example.name: intransitive, pilot as subject
example.text: Pilots, as well, routinely fly overtime to ensure that none are furloughed during seasonal lows.
example.arg: to ensure that none are furloughed during seasonal lows

example.name: with goal
example.text: He will fly to San Francisco on the afternoon of the 20th to participate in another round of speeches .
example.arg: to participate in another round of talks

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: [All of the first group of pilots who went abroad to receive training for new fighter aircraft]-1 have left the military *trace*-1 to fly for civilian airlines

example.name: with recipient
example.text: John flew the paper airplane to Mary.

example.name: With GOL
example.text: It is quite common to have 100 plus verbs flighting into a small pond.

example.name: With DIR
example.text: The maximum count of birds flighting in at dusk was a remarkable 183.

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: Just last week , for example , Trans World Airlines and Pan Am Corp. 's Pan American World Airways went so far as to offer cash rebates or gift checks of $ 200 to $ 1,000 to certain frequent-flier members making trans-Atlantic flights in business class or first class .
example.arg: in business class or first class.

example.name: pilot as subject, source and destination
example.text: This month we celebrate and remember Amelia Earhart's flight from Hawaii to California.

roleset.name: fly in the face of: flout
roleset.note: FLY-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on ULA. No VNcls. (from fly.02-v)

example.name: ULA example
example.text: There I believe we would decidedly fly in the face of established case law .
example.arg: in the face of established case law

roleset.name: hit a fly ball, has strange past participle
roleset.note: FLY-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in wsj-nw. Framed by Claire (from fly.03-v)

role.descr: where player moves to after hitting fly ball

example.name: Args 0 & 2
example.text: Kemp came closest to a home run in the fourth inning when he flied to very deep right field.

roleset.name: vpc version of fly.03, hit a fly ball
roleset.note: FLY_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in wsj-nw. Framed by Claire. (from fly.04-v)

role.descr: where the player moves to after hitting fly ball

example.name: Args 0 & 2, probably most common usage
example.text: But Clark flied out to short right field and Mitchell 's drive to left was caught on the warning track by Rickey Henderson as 62,000 sets of lungs exhaled as one .

example.name: With arg1, probably unusual usage
example.text: The night before, Katz had come up empty-handed in a similar opportunity when he flied out the bases full in the seventh inning with the Tigers.
example.arg: in the seventh inning with the Tigers

roleset.name: running away
roleset.note: FLIGHT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, flee.01. Corresponds to VNcls escape-51.1-1. (from flight.02-n)

example.name: arg0
example.text: Coupled with mass immigration , established immigrants having children , and white flight .

example.name: arg0, 1
example.text: ...their flight from Ireland and death in exile...
